title: I have no agency over this game anymore
body:
I've never gotten more S ranks and lost
I've never had more trouble getting out of mid gold (diamond last season and plat all seasons before)
I've never had more trouble beating silver level yasuos and katarinas and zeds
I've never felt so dependent on what team mates matchmaking gives me
I've never felt so impotent playing a defensive macro style for mid game
I've never played so poorly and still won games just because i picked the right champion
I've never played so well and lost because i picked the "wrong" champion.


What determines if i win or not?
How i felt all previous seasons:
50% how well i played
40% how good my team mates were
10% what champion I picked


How I feel now:
50% how good my team mates are
40% what champion I pick
10% how well I actually play

Riot Help Me

When I began playing League at the start of S7, one of the aspects I loved most was the strategic component (objectives, rotations, wave management, timings etc.). This is all gone. Just totally gone. Summoner's Rift feels like a 3-lane ARAM now. Everyone throws their shit at the enemy, and the shit that eventually hits harder wins the game.

Please, ever since Riot pulled the DQ out of their asses this game's been getting worse.

If For Honor wouldn't have turned out to be shit, I'd be playing that instead of League, but for now Riot is still slightly better than Ubisoft and the rest of friends.

Imho the addition of trinkets and class specific items is what truly lead to the downfall of the game. Being pigeonholed into a metagame and a certain playstyle, _NOT BECAUSE IT IS OPTIMAL,_ but _BECAUSE IT WAS **MADE** OPTIMAL_ makes the game bland and uninteresting. Playing the game how I want to play it, as long as I don't hurt other players, is what makes a game truly enjoyable. Having the entire game changed around me so that I can't play a champion a certain way or run an unconventional strat? Makes me want to quit the game.

You can't see interesting shit like AP kog or M5 running shyvana jungle, a previous exclusive toplaner, when champions are outright designed with a role in mind.

Don't forget fucking Keystones that have been a cancer for a long time and around which champions are balanced.

When masteries offered like +5% damage tops it was fine.
Now we've reached a point where they offer up to 20% increase and where 1 proc from a rune can halve tower's HP.

Of course that wouldn't be entirely bad, if everybody could utilize them in the same way.
But you can't and never will.

At that point I just started treating League as a new game and the old League as dead and gone. 

Everyone was so busy whining about supports being the bitches of botlane, statchecking, and unfun/toxic to play against that the game has gone utterly bland, we have things that are broken that *can't* be fixed by upping or lowering stats, strategy as a whole and the concept of investment has gone away (free wards means no one is slowing down full build to stay safe anymore). 

This game went from a live action chess game to a brawler/reaction speed game real quick.

Gods how I miss the strategy of League.  When it was all about careful, measured aggression, and chipping away at your opponent and then all-inning them when they stepped a tad too far from safety, or stayed one wave too long. Now I just play Total War, and haven't touched League in weeks.

Until the introduction of items like Shiv, Essence Reaver and Hurricane literally the only build that was viable on any ADC that wasn't an AD caster (Ez and Corki) was {{item:3006}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3035}} (before it got split up into Mortal Reminder and LDR) {{item:3026}} (previous incarnation that didn't grant AD). Going into grandpa mode and kept saying this vefore and I'll still keep saying forever. Fuck class power spikes. Draven and Lucian were early game lane bullies and dropped off due to their kits. Quinn is the only Marksmen whom is a early game bully and drops off now.

Marksmen also had to strategize which items to get back then, as in buy a defensive item. Usually GA and it didn't give damage. That was enough however because Marksmen power budget was based on being protected by their teams. Only lane bullies like once again Draven and Lucian, with the exception of hyper carry Vayne, could duel. Even then Vayne had to becareful not to duel tanky champions with Thornmail while Draven's and Lucian's kits were designed to get past Thornmail. I feel like only Jhin has to becareful when it comes to dueling now, and Marksmen power budget is no longer based on teams protecting them. Which gave them even more power.

Bah Marksmen have been given too much power and say over the years. Basically the only late game carries now. Also having their early game buffed to avoid "ADC20k17". So now they are good early game, great mid game, god late game.

I started playing in early 2010. I've been diamond multiple times, played thousands of games, hit the absolute top aram elo (queues times of 25 mins ftw), and i thought i'd continue to play this game for years to come. But I'm done now. This used to be a strategic game with laning and teamfights being expressions of skill with ample opportunity for outplays and meaningful interactions. The game has really evolved into something more resembling a brawler or even a fps with every fight being a clusterfuck decided mainly by who fired first and matchups. Almost every game boils down to champs picked and first blood and snowballing. Individual agency is mostly a relic of the past at this point. It just feels like you're spectating your own games when they snowball 50% of the time in your favor and 50% of the time they snowball against your team. Right now it feels like personal skill and strategy have minimal impact on outcomes, when a couple seasons ago they were paramount. Fun has just slowly melted away from LoL as the game has morphed into its current form. Maybe riot can fix the game some day but that just doesn't seem likely at this point. A shame since a good match of LoL in seasons past was among the best experiences in gaming.
You cannot solo carry this game anymore. If one out of your 5 man team makes one mistake, it's game over.
That is only true at the highest levels of play where mistakes are uncommon. At lower levels of play your opponents are just as likely to make mistakes that you or your team can capitalize on.

I understand it's a team game which is why i get so tired of people saying well solo carry etc. season 7 and so far what this season is looking it's not possible unless you're bot. Now champ picks are even more weighted and it's gotten to not be any fun to log in and play.

I worked on my game a lot this last season just for busted metas to curtail me cause i was always on the team that did not want to go ardent(which i still  say it's bullshit to force teams into this box of play this or lose all champs and styles should be good at some point).  But yeah it's boiled down to now it's either you pick the "right" champs and hope your team can play them or suffer. Then when you add that up every game has pretty much become a stomp one way or the other. As a jg and my two main jgs being strong so far i am bored in my role cause it feels like if my team has the right champs and they can play them i can get them ahead and do my job. But if my team has all the "wrong" picks i can't get them ahead hard enough. I don't even know what else to say.

It actually has absolutely everything to do with the Support role.  That may sound far-fetched so hear me out.

ADCs being strong skews the metagame somewhat.  Supports actually flip it on its head by being changed over the past years from adding to the strength of teammates in general to amplifying the strength of a single teammate.  Factor in damage creep and the meta's a perfect storm that perpetually creates games  where single carries obliterate entire teams, meaning that in order to come back from that the other team needs to have a hard counter to said champion full stop.  

There are no exceptions to the meta, no alternatives and no outplay potential there; have the champion that beats the enemy champion or lose.  And because winning from snowballing is now so easy,  multiple hypercarries on each team is a must in everything but pro play.  ADC's are still relevant then because, really, each and every single one of them is now a hypercarry at this point.

League of Snowballs.  Happy Winter everyone.
